problem.markdown:
>>Which of the following examples justify the use of the truncated normal distribution? <<
[x] When modeling demand of a product. [ ] When modeling the error of a manufacturing process. [ ] When modeling the returns of a stock portfolio. [x] When modeling inventory in a warehouse.
[Explanation] Truncated normal distribution is typically associated with random variables that cannot take on negative values. The demand of a product and inventory level in a warehouse cannot take on negative values. [Explanation]
